articles.title: S&P 500 Futures Advance, Japanese Bonds Rebound: Markets Wrap - Bloomberg.com
articles.description: Japanese bonds rebounded after a selloff that rippled through global debt markets, while US equity-index futures rose as volatility showed tentative signs of easing.

articles.title: Sony to Cede Control of Bravia TVs to China’s TCL Electronics - Bloomberg.com
articles.description: Sony Group Corp. is spinning off control of its home entertainment business, including the flagship Bravia television brand, to Chinese rival TCL Electronics Holdings Ltd., the latest Japanese company to cut exposure in the low-margin segment.

articles.title: Warren Buffett's successor eyes selling off Berkshire Hathaway's 325 million Kraft Heinz shares - AP News
articles.description: Warren Buffett’s successor appears to be considering his first significant move after taking over as CEO this month. Kraft Heinz warned investors Tuesday that Berkshire Hathaway may be interested in selling its 325 million shares in the name brand food giant …

articles.title: Amazon gets approval to build massive retail concept in Orland Park - chicago.suntimes.com
articles.description: The estimated 230,000-square-foot store will offer shoppers general merchandise and grocery items.

articles.title: Anthropic’s CEO stuns Davos with Nvidia criticism - TechCrunch
articles.description: Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei unloaded on both the administration and U.S. chip companies over plans to sell to China. The criticism was particularly notable because one of those chipmakers, Nvidia, is a major partner and investor in Anthropic.

articles.title: UPDATED: Judge approves sale of Genesis HealthCare assets to bidder 101 West Street - McKnight's Long-Term Care News
articles.description: A federal bankruptcy judge on Tuesday evening approved the sale of Genesis HealthCare and its nearly 300 subsidiaries to a newly formed investment group whose bid emerged as a surprise last week.

articles.title: Stock futures are little changed after S&P 500 and Dow notch worst day since October: Live updates - CNBC
articles.description: All three major U.S. stock indexes logged their worst daily performances since Oct. 10 as Trump escalated his Greenland tariff threats.

articles.title: Fact Sheet: President Donald J. Trump Stops Wall Street from Competing with Main Street Homebuyers - The White House (.gov)
articles.description: STOPPING WALL STREET FROM COMPETING WITH MAIN STREET HOMEBUYERS: Today, President Donald J. Trump signed an Executive Order to protect the American Dream

articles.title: Billionaire Dalio sends 2-word warning as stocks sell-off - thestreet.com
articles.description: The former hedge fund manager offered a blunt take on markets.

articles.title: Zuck stuck on Trump’s bad side: FTC appeals loss in Meta monopoly case - Ars Technica
articles.description: FTC will appeal ruling that found Meta has no monopoly in social networking.

articles.title: Netflix Stock Is Tumbling. This Is Overshadowing the Streamer’s Earnings Beat. - Barron's
Supreme Court to weigh Trump's bid to oust Lisa Cook from Fed board, with Powell probe looming over arguments - CBS News
articles.description: President Trump moved to fire Lisa Cook from the Federal Reserve Board of Governors in August.

articles.title: Trump's tariff threats spark new fears of 'Sell America' trade - Politico
articles.description: The president has long been sensitive to bond market movements and regularly cites surges in stocks as evidence that his agenda is working.

articles.title: Markets Slump as Greenland, Japan Fears Shake Up Torpid Trading - Bloomberg.com
articles.description: As financial markets settled into an unusual state of tranquility, with stocks slowly grinding higher week after week and bond yields hovering in narrow ranges, many on Wall Street started to prepare for a sudden jolt.

articles.title: Danish pension fund to sell $100 million in U.S. Treasuries due to "poor U.S. government finances" - CBS News
articles.description: The chief investment officer of AkademikerPension said the decision was not directly related to the rift between the U.S. and Greenland.

articles.title: Trump added $2.25 trillion to the national debt in his first year back in charge, watchdog says - Fortune
articles.description: The Peter G. Peterson Foundation, a nonpartisan budget watchdog, ran the numbers exclusively for Fortune.

articles.description: Mortgage rates jumped sharply higher on Tuesday in response to weakness driven by geopolitical events and overseas financial markets. After hitting lows of 5.99% for a few hours on January 9th and spending last week in the low 6's, the average top tier 30yr f…

articles.title: This innovation saved lives in the pandemic. Now it’s showing strength against cancer. - The Washington Post
articles.description: The experimental mRNA-based drug sharply reduced the risk of recurrence or death when combined with immunotherapy Keytruda, according to the drugs’ sponsors.
